certificateTitles: Supervised Machine Learning: Regression and Classification
certificatesDescription: Stanford University in collaboration with DeepLearning.AI offers a 3-course specialization on Machine Learning. The specialization covers the concepts of Machine Learning, Deep Learning, and Reinforcement Learning. The specialization is taught by Andrew Ng, the founder of deeplearning.ai and Adjunct Professor at Stanford University.

Completed the course on Supervised Machine Learning: Regression and Classification offered by Stanford University in collaboration with DeepLearning.AI. The course covers the concepts of Linear Regression, Logistic Regression, Regularization, and Neural Networks.

It's a 4-week course, taught by prof. Andrew Ng. Learned about neural networks, training models, activation functions, softmax, Adams algorithm, ML model diagnostics, cross-validation, bias, variance, decision trees, XGBoost, and what not.
It's a 4-week course, taught by prof. Andrew Ng. Learned about clustering, recommender systems, anomaly detection, and reinforcement learning.
Became the campus ambassador at devincept. Had to attend camps, find guests for its events, and many more.
Cleared JavaScript Data Structures and Algorithms course from Free Code Camp, which was an approx 300 hrs of coursework.
Attended a six days certification course from Sica College. Learnt basics of HTML, CSS and blockchain.

Became a microsoft technology associate in my 12th grade itself. Had to learn basic and advance python programming language, and clear Microsoft 98-381 exam in order to get recognized as a microsoft technology associate.
